BTech: Courses, Admission, Eligibility, Syllabus, Colleges, Placement, Jobs

  2. >Courses
  3. >BE/B.Tech

Ishika Ray

Bachelor of Technology (BTech) is the full form of BTech. BTech is a professional undergraduate engineering degree for candidates who have completed four years of study in an accredited university or college. Every year, India graduates more than 10 lakh engineers, and there are over 2500 engineering colleges and 1300 polytechnic institutes in the country. 

The JEE Main and JEE Advanced entrance exams are the most common for Btech admission. In addition to these entrance exams at the national level, students can apply to the course by taking a variety of entrance exams at the state and private levels. 

Check Also: BTech Placements

Class 12 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics is the minimum requirement for admission to a BTech program. A BTech degree focuses on the development of diverse technical skills and knowledge connected to the utilization of engineering concepts. 

BTech programs cover algebra, engineering fundamentals, computer applications, programming, and electronics. Through coursework and practicals, students obtain a complete understanding of the field they have selected, enabling them to become experts in the industry and get ready for an engineering career.

BTech Admission Process

The colleges and different entrance exams play a significant role in the BTech admissions process. The Btech admission process is as follows: 

  • Students who are interested in applying to the BTech degree program must take a variety of admission exams or tests, including JEE Main, JEE Advanced, BITSAT, WBJEE and AP EAMCET.
  • The institutes use these entrance exams to assist them enroll students based on merit. Individuals are chosen and put through additional screening procedures based on their performances in the aforementioned entrance exams before being admitted to the B Tech program.

BTech Eligibility

The students who study PMS (physics, chemistry, mathematics) as their main subject are eligible for BTech Qualification. Because students from this background are slightly preferred, also, they have an advantage in the programme. Below, are the eligibility criteria mentioned:

  • A student with a diploma in engineering domains is eligible to enroll in a Bachelor of Technology programme.
  • The students must qualify for their 10+2 examination from the science stream from any board.
  • The students must have secured 60% marks in their class 12.
  • Also, the BTech eligibility criteria can vary from institute to institute.

Top BTech Entrance Examination

Several institutions offer several exams to gain admission into BTech courses. Below, the exams are explained according to national, state, and institute-specific examinations.

JEE Mains

To select and screen candidates for admission to B.Tech. programs at institutions like the National Institutes of Technology (NITs), Indian Institutes of Information Technology (IIITs), and Government Funded Technical Institutes (GFTIs), JEE Main is a national engineering entrance exam. On the other hand, many public and private colleges also accept JEE Main scores for admission. The entrance exam for JEE Main also serves as a qualification test for JEE Advanced.

JEE Advanced

The JEE Advanced is the screening test for applicants to the Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs). Those who rank in the top 2,50,000 in JEE Main can take JEE Advanced.

WBJEE

The West Bengal Joint Admission Examinations Board (WBJEEB) oversees the WBJEE, a state-level entrance examination. It is held for students interested in being admitted into the undergraduate engineering courses provided by the participating institutes.

BITSAT

For students interested in enrolling in B Tech programs offered at BITS Pilani and other campuses like BITS Goa and BITS Hyderabad, the Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani administers the BITSAT, a university-level entrance exam.

VITEEE

The Vellore College of Technology administers the VITEEE, a university-level entrance test, to candidates interested in enrolling in the B Tech programs offered at the Vellore and Chennai campuses of the college. Students can check the VITEEE cutoff on the Vellore Institute of Technology website.

Btech Syllabus

Every BTech course specialization has unique course content. All disciplines' first-year course offerings are remarkably identical, and there aren't many options for branch electives. The branch-specific course content is available to students starting in the third semester.

The common subjects in the first semester and second semester are as follows:

Btech graduates are hired in various industries, including KPO/Research Analytics, Accounting, and Finance. Recruiters from top companies visit several institutions throughout the last year to find suitable candidates.

BTech: FAQs

Ques. What criteria must applicants for B.Tech admissions meet?

Ans. For admission to the B.Tech program, students must pass the 10+2 qualifying test in PCM or PCB.

Ques. What is the IIT admissions procedure?

Ans. The students must take the JEE Main exam to be considered for IIT admissions. They will be eligible for JEE Advanced if they receive a qualifying score in JEE Main and place among the top 2,50,000 applicants. After passing JEE Advanced, individuals must participate in the Joint Seat Allocation Authority's (JoSAA's) shared counselling process. The availability of seats and the ranks attained will determine who gets admitted to IITs.

Ques. How many B.Tech specializations are there?

Ans. A wide range of specializations are available in B.Tech. During admissions, students must choose the one they like. Engineering specialities include electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, computer science engineering, and civil engineering.

Ques. What are a candidate's options after a B.Tech?

Ans. Students with a B.Tech degree have the option of starting their careers by working or continuing their education. They can finish their M.Tech or choose to get their MBA.

Ques. What is the full name of B Tech?

Ans. Bachelor of Technology, or B Tech, is the official name of this undergraduate engineering degree program. The BTech program lasts four years and is broken up into eight semesters.

Ques. What is the primary difference between a bachelor's in engineering and a bachelor's in technology?

Ans. In comparison to BTech degrees, bachelor of engineering courses are more theoretical in character. Regarding the course content and program approach, there are significant differences between these two-degree programs. While other engineering universities provide the well-liked BTech program, most of India's historic institutions, like the Indian Institute of Science, still offer the BE program. These two classes are regarded as being interchangeable. Therefore, many well-known universities provide BTech, while only a few colleges in India still offer the BE program.

Ques. What types of jobs are available to a BTech graduate?

Ans. An information security professional, data analyst, software developer, networking engineer, database administrator, testing engineer, and game developer are just a few of the employment opportunities available to CSE BTech graduates. Despite differences in nomenclature across different engineering specialities, technical and administrative positions can be broadly categorized into two categories. After completing the BTech program, candidates can pursue either of the jobs and build a successful career.

Ques. What qualifications are needed for a BTech?

Ans. The following skills are necessary for candidates to succeed in their BTech course. Look at this:

  • Ability to communicate - verbal and written
  • Familiarity with Industry Standards
  • Knowledge of the core subject
  • Teamwork
  • Creativity
  • Multi-disciplinary exposure
  • Application of the knowledge
  • Leadership Skills
  • Analytical & Creative thinking
  • Acquaintance with Computers & IT

Ques. What does a BTech engineer make on average in India?

Ans. A BTech graduate can expect to make between INR 15,000 and 30,000 per month as a newcomer. In other situations, a candidate's remuneration depends on the job description. A Project Engineer or Design Mechanical Engineer may expect to make between 1.5 and 8 lakhs per year on average. Candidates who have worked for companies for more than 4-6 years can expect to earn between 7 and 12 LPA. Professionals with mid-level entry-level positions have a better chance of making more money. Many professionals enrol in certification programs to advance their knowledge and skills and increase their income.

Ques. How many BTech semesters are there?

Ans. The BTech course has eight semesters and lasts four years.
